main event: Observers reported seeing an oval-shaped red-orange glowing object hovering above the area for about 7-10 seconds on December 5, 1966.
interesting points: The object was described as oval and egg-shaped by different observers., The observers compared the size of the object to a half dollar held at arm's length., No sound was heard from the object, even when nearby truck engines were turned off., The weather conditions included rain and haze, possibly affecting visibility., Despite a visual check by investigators, no evidence of the object was found at the time.
location: 1 mile east of Honda Canyon Road, California, USA
witness description: Two military personnel, familiar with conventional aircraft, could not identify the object.
